meanings.sent1: The hungry child gormandised the cookies in one sitting.
meanings.sent2: She gormandised the entire pizza by herself.
meanings.sent3: The raccoon gormandised the trash left outside.
meanings.sent4: The bookworm gormandised the words on the pages.
meanings.sent5: The squirrel gormandised the nuts, storing them for winter.

meanings.definition: To indulge in eating to excess.
meanings.sent1: During the holidays, he gormandised on sweets and treats.
meanings.sent2: She gormandised on rich desserts at the buffet.
meanings.sent3: The cat gormandised on the catnip, rolling around in delight.
meanings.sent4: The fire gormandised the forest, leaving only ashes behind.
meanings.sent5: The storm gormandised the coastline, eroding it over time.
